intro: Atropis laxa, commonly known as the slender marsh orchid, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in eastern North America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces oval, greenish-brown capsules as fruit. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often emerging from the base of the plant. Atropis laxa is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
